title: Israel says it 'eliminated' Hezbollah finance chief in Syria
content: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.
summary: The Israeli military announced it eliminated a Hezbollah commander overseeing the group’s finances in Syria and intensified strikes on Hezbollah’s financial infrastructure in Lebanon. This follows the killing of the unit’s former leader and targeted financial institutions accused of funding military activities to halt Hezbollah’s capacity and support of Hamas.

title: Israel strikes Hezbollah-affiliated financial branches across Lebanon
content: The Israeli military launched air strikes targeting Al-Qard al-Hasan branches in Lebanon, linked to Hezbollah, to disrupt their financial operations and weaken support. This escalation aims to impede Hezbollah’s activities by hitting its financial network, impacting their ability to function amid Lebanon's ongoing crisis.
summary: The Israeli military launched air strikes targeting Al-Qard al-Hasan branches in Lebanon, linked to Hezbollah, to disrupt their financial operations and weaken support. This escalation aims to impede Hezbollah’s activities by hitting its financial network, impacting their ability to function amid Lebanon's ongoing crisis.

title: Olivia Nuzzi leaves New York Magazine over secret relationship with Kennedy Jr
content: ​"Nevertheless, the magazine and Nuzzi agreed that the best course forward is to part ways. Nuzzi is a uniquely talented writer and we have been proud to publish her work over her nearly eight years as our Washington Correspondent. We wish her the best," New York Magazine issued a statement which also said that Nuzzi was not biased in ger coverage of the 2024 campaign.
summary: ​"Nevertheless, the magazine and Nuzzi agreed that the best course forward is to part ways. Nuzzi is a uniquely talented writer and we have been proud to publish her work over her nearly eight years as our Washington Correspondent. We wish her the best," New York Magazine issued a statement which also said that Nuzzi was not biased in ger coverage of the 2024 campaign.

title: Diddy seeks 'gag' order on witnesses, lawyers: 'Inflammatory, extrajudicial statements'
content: ​“As the Court is aware, Mr. Combs has been the target of an unending stream of allegations by prospective witnesses and their counsel in the press,” Diddy's lawyers wrote. “These prospective witnesses and their lawyers have made numerous inflammatory extrajudicial statements aimed at assassinating Mr. Combs’s character in the press.”
summary: ​“As the Court is aware, Mr. Combs has been the target of an unending stream of allegations by prospective witnesses and their counsel in the press,” Diddy's lawyers wrote. “These prospective witnesses and their lawyers have made numerous inflammatory extrajudicial statements aimed at assassinating Mr. Combs’s character in the press.”

title: Hezbollah says Israeli army intelligence base near Tel Aviv targeted
content: ​Hezbollah fighters launched "quality rockets" at "the Glilot base of the Military Intelligence Unit 8200 in the Tel Aviv suburbs," the group said on Monday adding the attack was "in defense of Lebanon," "in response to Israeli aggressions" and dedicated to their slain leader Hassan Nasrallah. ​The Israeli army said its forces were pummelling Hezbollah's financial arm, hitting more than two dozen targets including a bunker with tens of millions of dollars in cash and gold. The strikes since Sunday night mark an expansion of Israel's campaign against the Iran-backed group
summary: ​Hezbollah fighters launched "quality rockets" at "the Glilot base of the Military Intelligence Unit 8200 in the Tel Aviv suburbs," the group said on Monday adding the attack was "in defense of Lebanon," "in response to Israeli aggressions" and dedicated to their slain leader Hassan Nasrallah. ​The Israeli army said its forces were pummelling Hezbollah's financial arm, hitting more than two dozen targets including a bunker with tens of millions of dollars in cash and gold. The strikes since Sunday night mark an expansion of Israel's campaign against the Iran-backed group

title: Trump explains why he's much ahead of Harris on Polymarket: 'They got to know her'
content: Donald Trump leads Kamala Harris by over 20 points on Polymarket, a decentralized prediction market. ​The Polymarket surge in favor of Donald Trump is reportedly manipulated. One of the four accounts on Polymarket that have fueled speculation over their large bets has taken even bigger wagers. The four top accounts on the cryptocurrency-prediction exchange are owned by non-Americans as Polymarket does not allow Americans to register.
summary: Donald Trump leads Kamala Harris by over 20 points on Polymarket, a decentralized prediction market. ​The Polymarket surge in favor of Donald Trump is reportedly manipulated. One of the four accounts on Polymarket that have fueled speculation over their large bets has taken even bigger wagers. The four top accounts on the cryptocurrency-prediction exchange are owned by non-Americans as Polymarket does not allow Americans to register.

title: Mark Cuban wanted Elon Musk and Kamala Harris to be friends. Then this happened...
content: ​"100%. Yeah, for sure. Why not? Look, she's been very clear—she's going to work with Republicans. She's not an ideologue, and that's key. She talks about it all the time. She wants to be a problem-solver. She's open-minded and willing to collaborate," Cuban said as he finally gave the answer to whether Kamala Harris will work with Elon Musk if she wins the election.
summary: ​"100%. Yeah, for sure. Why not? Look, she's been very clear—she's going to work with Republicans. She's not an ideologue, and that's key. She talks about it all the time. She wants to be a problem-solver. She's open-minded and willing to collaborate," Cuban said as he finally gave the answer to whether Kamala Harris will work with Elon Musk if she wins the election.

title: Liz Cheney says many Republicans will vote for Harris: 'They might not be public...'
content: "In this election and especially here in Pennsylvania, we have the opportunity to tell the whole world who we are. We have the chance to say we are going to reject cruelty, vile and vitriol that we have seen from Donald Trump, we are going to reject the misogyny that we have seen from JD Vance and Donald Trump... We have the chance to remind people that we are a good country..." Liz Cheney said. "She has a sincere heart and that's what I am honored to be here to be supporting her in this race".
summary: "In this election and especially here in Pennsylvania, we have the opportunity to tell the whole world who we are. We have the chance to say we are going to reject cruelty, vile and vitriol that we have seen from Donald Trump, we are going to reject the misogyny that we have seen from JD Vance and Donald Trump... We have the chance to remind people that we are a good country..." Liz Cheney said. "She has a sincere heart and that's what I am honored to be here to be supporting her in this race".

title: Who is Christy Clark? Former BC premier interested in replacing Trudeau if he steps down
content: Former BC premier Christy Clark expresses interest in leading the federal Liberal Party amid internal pressure on Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to step down. Clark emphasizes unity and practical solutions to issues like cost of living, healthcare, and climate change. Preparing for a potential role, she stays active in political commentary and is improving her French.
summary: Former BC premier Christy Clark expresses interest in leading the federal Liberal Party amid internal pressure on Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to step down. Clark emphasizes unity and practical solutions to issues like cost of living, healthcare, and climate change. Preparing for a potential role, she stays active in political commentary and is improving her French.

title: Cuba struggles as tropical storm Oscar brings heavy rains and power outages
content: Cuba's widespread blackouts stretched into their fourth day as Hurricane Oscar crossed the island’s eastern coast with winds and heavy rain.In Santo Suárez, part of a populous neighborhood in southwestern Havana, people went into the streets banging pots and pans in protest Sunday night. The protesters, who say they have no water either, blocked the street with garbage.
summary: Cuba's widespread blackouts stretched into their fourth day as Hurricane Oscar crossed the island’s eastern coast with winds and heavy rain.In Santo Suárez, part of a populous neighborhood in southwestern Havana, people went into the streets banging pots and pans in protest Sunday night. The protesters, who say they have no water either, blocked the street with garbage.

title: Biggest fund-raising quarter ever: How Harris surpassed Trump in money
content: Vice President Kamala Harris's campaign raised a record $1 billion in the quarter ending September, with $378 million in September alone. Donald Trump's campaign raised $160 million in September. Harris's big donors include Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Larsen but her campaign did not disclose the biggest donor. Trump has consistently raised less money than his 2020 run and is now resorting to cost-cutting methods.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris's campaign raised a record $1 billion in the quarter ending September, with $378 million in September alone. Donald Trump's campaign raised $160 million in September. Harris's big donors include Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Larsen but  her campaign did not disclose the biggest donor. Trump has consistently raised less money than his 2020 run and is now resorting to cost-cutting methods.

title: Biden reveals plans to provide free over-the-counter contraceptives
content: President Biden unveiled a plan to expand access to contraceptives, including free over-the-counter options, aimed at benefiting 52 million women with private insurance. Vice President Harris termed it the largest expansion in a decade. The proposal is subject to a 60-day public comment period.
summary: President Biden unveiled a plan to expand access to contraceptives, including free over-the-counter options, aimed at benefiting 52 million women with private insurance. Vice President Harris termed it the largest expansion in a decade. The proposal is subject to a 60-day public comment period.

title: Beheaded King Charles cartoon after 'you are not my king' protest: Major row in Australia, post deleted
content: Australian senator Lidia Thorpe shared a cartoon of beheaded King Charles on her Instagram story after protesting his parliament speech. Facing flak, she deleted the story and posted a clarification that it was shared without her knowledge. "Earlier tonight, without my knowledge, one of my staff shared an image to my Instagram stories created by another account, I deleted it as soon as I saw. I would not intentionally share anything that could be seen to encourage violence against anyone. That's not what I'm about," she posted.​​
summary: Australian senator Lidia Thorpe shared a cartoon of beheaded King Charles on her Instagram story after protesting his parliament speech. Facing flak, she deleted the story and posted a clarification that it was shared without her knowledge. "Earlier tonight, without my knowledge, one of my staff shared an image to my Instagram stories created by another account, I deleted it as soon as I saw. I would not intentionally share anything that could be seen to encourage violence against anyone. That's not what I'm about," she posted.​​

title: 'No copy of Sheikh Hasina's resignation letter': Bangladesh president recounts mayhem of August 5
content: President Mohammed Shahabuddin revealed the absence of documented evidence of Sheikh Hasina's resignation amidst chaos on August 5. Although Shahabuddin and the army chief heard of her departure, no formal resignation was found. Hasina's son clarified she never officially resigned due to the sudden unrest, leaving her technically in office.
summary: President Mohammed Shahabuddin revealed the absence of documented evidence of Sheikh Hasina's resignation amidst chaos on August 5. Although Shahabuddin and the army chief heard of her departure, no formal resignation was found. Hasina's son clarified she never officially resigned due to the sudden unrest, leaving her technically in office.

title: Two celebrities named on Diddy list, accused of assaulting 13-year-old
content: The complainant of the latest lawsuit alleged that she was offered a strange, fruity drink after which she felt drowsy. She went to lie down in a bedroom. Combs and a male and a female, both reportedly famous, came into the room. "You are ready to party," Combs told her, according to the complaint.

title: McDonald’s tells workers it doesn’t endorse political candidates after Trump visit
content: McDonald's maintains neutrality in the presidential election, stating it doesn't endorse candidates. Despite Trump's visit to a Pennsylvania location and cooking there, the company emphasises its open-door policy. They've also invited Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, underscoring their non-partisan stance.
summary: McDonald's maintains neutrality in the presidential election, stating it doesn't endorse candidates. Despite Trump's visit to a Pennsylvania location and cooking there, the company emphasises its open-door policy. They've also invited Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, underscoring their non-partisan stance.

title: Donald Trump's McDonald's gig was staged? Outlet was closed for the day?
content: An unverified notice sparked speculations that the entire event of Donald Trump working at a McDonald's in Pennsylvania was staged, with closed doors and vetted customers. The Washington Post reported that the restaurant was closed and the customer whom Trump served were screened by the Secret Service and positioned before his arrival making it clear that they did not by chance arrived and was gobsmacked to see Donald Trump handing them their fries -- they were well prepared.
summary: An unverified notice sparked speculations that the entire event of Donald Trump working at a McDonald's in Pennsylvania was staged, with closed doors and vetted customers. The Washington Post reported that the restaurant was closed and the customer whom Trump served were screened by the Secret Service and positioned before his arrival making it clear that they did not by chance arrived and was gobsmacked to see Donald Trump handing them their fries -- they were well prepared.

title: Is Election Day 2024 a federal holiday? All you need to know
content: Election Day is not a federal holiday but some states observe it as a holiday. State offices will be closed on November 5 in Delaware, Hawaii, Illinois, Indiana, Louisiana, Maryland, Michigan, Montana, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Virginia, West Virginia. 24 state and the district of Columbia offer paid time off to vote.
summary: Election Day is not a federal holiday but some states observe it as a holiday. State offices will be closed on November 5 in Delaware, Hawaii, Illinois, Indiana, Louisiana, Maryland, Michigan, Montana, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, Virginia, West Virginia. 24 state and the district of Columbia offer paid time off to vote.

title: 'They have our skulls': Why Australia senator Lidia Thorpe heckled King Charles
content: King Charles faced a verbal attack by indigenous senator Lidia Thorpe during his Australian parliament speech as the senator called him to return indigenous remains and land. Explaining her action, Thorpe told Sky News that Charles should answer for the thousands of massacre sited in Australia. "We have our bones and our skulls still in his possession -- or in his family's possession. We want that back," the senator said.
summary: King Charles faced a verbal attack by indigenous senator Lidia Thorpe during his Australian parliament speech as the senator called him to return indigenous remains and land. Explaining her action, Thorpe told Sky News that Charles should answer for the thousands of massacre sited in Australia. "We have our bones and our skulls still in his possession -- or in his family's possession. We want that back," the senator said.

title: Fethullah Gülen dies at 83: Who was self-exiled spiritual leader accused of Trukish coup attempt in 2016
content: Fethullah Gulen, the Islamic leader accused by Turkey of masterminding the 2016 coup attempt, has died at 83. Gulen's Hizmet movement was influential globally in education and media before falling out with Erdogan in 2013. Post-coup, Turkey prosecuted numerous followers, while Gulen remained in the U.S., resisting extradition.
summary: Fethullah Gulen, the Islamic leader accused by Turkey of masterminding the 2016 coup attempt, has died at 83. Gulen's Hizmet movement was influential globally in education and media before falling out with Erdogan in 2013. Post-coup, Turkey prosecuted numerous followers, while Gulen remained in the U.S., resisting extradition.
